verses.roman:
aho bhoja-pate yūyaṁ
janma-bhājo nṛṇām iha
yat paśyathāsakṛt kṛṣṇaṁ
durdarśam api yoginām

synonyms: aho—ah; bhoja-pate—O master of the Bhojas, Ugrasena; yūyam—you; janma-bhājaḥ—having taken a worthwhile birth; nṛṇām—among men; iha—in this world; yat—because; paśyatha—you see; asakṛt—repeatedly; kṛṣṇam—Lord Kṛṣṇa; durdarśam—rarely seen; api—even; yoginām—by great mystics.
translation: [The kings said:] O King of the Bhojas, you alone among men have achieved a truly exalted birth, for you continually behold Lord Kṛṣṇa, who is rarely visible even to great yogīs.
